version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

bn:00068465n: Metal material discarded during manufacturing or processing operations which cannot be directly fed back into the operation.
Scrap consists of recyclable materials left over from product manufacturing and consumption, such as parts of vehicles, building supplies, and surplus materials.
Discarded or waste material; rubbish, trash.

Municipal solid waste, commonly known as trash or garbage, refuse or rubbish is a waste type consisting of everyday items that are discarded by the public.
Items or material that have been discarded.

Unwanted or undesired material, usually discarded.

bn:00006308n: A waste container is a container for temporarily storing waste, and is usually made out of metal or plastic.
A receptacle, which serves as a place to discard waste materials.
A container for the collection of waste.
A receptacle, usually roughly cylindrical and wider at the top than at the bottom, which serves as a place to discard waste materials.
Any container for waste, whether a larger outdoors one or a smaller indoors one.
A bin for holding rubbish until it can be collected; a garbage can.
A bin that holds rubbish until it is collected
An outdoor rubbish bin on wheels for easier movability.

bn:00066629n: A recycling bin is a container used to hold recyclables before they are taken to recycling centers.
A bin for depositing things to be recycled
